title: Targets not met as waste growth outpaces increase in population across Queensland
desc: Queensland is generating waste at a faster rate than its population growth, with hundreds of thousands of extra tonnes of rubbish added in the past year as the state government vows to boost recycling.

title: Police officer on the run after allegedly selling cannabis to inmate
desc: The Namibian Police (NamPol) are on the hunt for a fellow police officer who fled after allegedly selling drugs to a trial-awaiting inmate...

title: Arsenal consider late deadline day signing as key star suffers suspected broken foot
desc: Arsenal are weighing up making a deadline day signing after Mikel Merino's injury setback, talkSPORT understands.The midfielder missed his side's win

title: Kyrsten Sinema gave $9,000 to man she’s accused of having an affair with
desc: Funds, paid to former security guard Matthew Ammel, were from former US senator’s campaign committee in October

title: Four Brits die after suffering stomach bugs at resorts in Cape Verde
desc: Families are grieving after their loved ones died following severe gastric illnesses developed while on holiday.

title: Several regions enjoy weekend showers, more expected
desc: A FEW places in the Otjozondjupa, Khomas, Oshikoto, Kunene and //Kharas regions experienced light to moderate rainfall this weekend.

title: Unai Emery: 'Not fair' VAR call denied Tammy Abraham equaliser vs. Brentford
desc: Aston Villa boss Unai Emery says his side were unfairly denied a goal by VAR as their Premier League title hopes suffered a major blow in a 1-0 home defeat to 10-man Brentford.

title: Qld expecting storms and winds up to 80km/h after heatwave, flooding up north could last for weeks
desc: Flooding in north Queensland could last for several more weeks, and while the heatwave that has blanketed parts of the state comes to an end, it will be replaced by storms and severe winds.

title: Jen Z and Laura Fox ramp up the glam in dazzling looks on DWTS
desc: Get ready to cha-cha, tango, and waltz your way through the ninth season of Dancing with the Stars on RTÉ One and RTÉ Player.

title: Dominik Szoboszlai admits Liverpool future is 'not in my hands' as star midfielder delivers worrying update on contract extension talks
desc: Dominik Szoboszlai has cast doubt upon his Liverpool future in a worrying update for the Reds, with the midfielder admitting his future is "not in my hands" despite a clear desire to remain at Anfield. The 25-year-old has been one of the Reds' outstanding performers throughout an inconsistent season and talks over an extension are reported to be underway, with the Hungarian's current deal running until 2028.
